purpose: Provide advanced methodologies and examples for building and optimizing Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems.
principle: Utilizes vector databases like Pinecone, Weaviate, and Qdrant, combined with LLMs such as OpenAI to enhance information retrieval and generation.
reusability: Includes modular examples and tutorials that can be adapted for various RAG implementations, supporting multiple vector database integrations.
limitations: Primarily focused on Python and Jupyter Notebook environments; limited to the vector databases explicitly supported.
name: rag-cookbooks
description: This repository contains various advanced techniques for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems.
highlight: Comprehensive techniques for enhancing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems with various vector databases and LLM integrations.
